alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued November 30 at 9:29AM MST until December 03 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM FRIDAY TO 4 PM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulation 1 to 2 feet in the mountains and 4 to 8 inches in the valleys. * WHERE...Kellogg, Osburn, Lookout Pass, Wallace, Pinehurst, Fernwood, St. Maries, Fourth Of July Pass, Dobson Pass, and Mullan. * WHEN...From 4 PM Friday to 4 PM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light snow is expected Thursday Night into Friday morning, which may result in slick driving conditions. Snow intensity will likely increase Friday afternoon into Saturday morning. Look for a transition to rain in the valleys Saturday night with wet snow in the mountains.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
